A **pyrolisk**, c, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The pyrolisk is a small [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and is the only member of the [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice_\(monster_class\) "Cockatrice (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") to lack the [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")'s [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning")-related properties or dangerous touch attack.

A pyrolisk has a fiery [gaze attack](/wiki/Gaze_attack "Gaze attack") that damages anyone who makes eye contact unless they have [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), and can [burn](/wiki/Burn "Burn") [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), and [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") in the victim's inventoryinventory may [burned](/wiki/Burn "Burn") and be destroyed - if either the target or the pyrolisk are [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), the gaze has no effect. Interestingly, the gaze attacks can damage the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") even if they are [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible"), though the pyrolisk cannot naturally [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"); it is also possible for the gaze to miss in this circumstance. Pyrolisks possess fire resistance and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a pyrolisk [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 1⁄5 chance each (20%) of granting fire resistance or poison resistance.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 3eb2192d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/3eb2192d75ed7bcaded06780831595715744e17d), the fiery gaze attack of the pyrolisk now matches other fire attacks in terms of effects: it can burn cloth or leather armor, and will also heal [iron golems](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem") (including a hero [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into one). Per [commit e3712dbb](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/e3712dbb312b2930bbc3a0b2c6442f1eaf2fd958), the gaze will also reveal [hiding](/wiki/Hiding "Hiding") monsters that it targets.

Per [commit 83f8ec1c](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/83f8ec1c4327e75e63a44a8151eb454b0f4736bf), pyrolisks have an additional 1d6 bite attack, allowing them to deal damage even without their gaze. Per [commit 0a3d02b9](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/0a3d02b9d4e3f005149d4a5ff93bbda4d37958da), the pyrolisk will also not use its fiery gaze if it sees that the hero resists it.

Per [commit 2bec685b](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/2bec685bae641cc25aab40ff80154044c6aadf07), pyrolisk [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg") explode for 3d6 fire damage when they are broken or something attempts to eat them - pets will also avoid eating pyrolisk eggs.

[ ]

## Strategy

Pyrolisks are generally slow and weak, but their gaze covers a far wider range than most other attacks in the game - it can also be rendered completely harmless by blinding yourself, allowing you to dispatch it with ease. You can also blind the pyrolisk in question, though blinding yourself is typically easier and more convenient; [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") lets you track the pyrolisk while blind, and aids in spotting and warding off other potential threats that may be nearby. [Infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") can help spot a pyrolisk quickly in low-lit areas such as the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines").

If you notice a pyrolisk in the vicinity and have no means to blind yourself, stash your potions, scrolls and spellbooks in a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack") or other container - if all else fails, [drop](/wiki/Drop "Drop") them on the ground and be sure not to step too far away in case other monsters are nearby. If you are confident in your [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") and have an item such as a [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning") or [expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera"), you may consider trying to line up with the pyrolisk and blind them using it, then finish them off quickly.

### As a pet

A pyrolisk is not a particularly amazing pet, but its gaze attack does not provoke counterattacks unless they are ranged in nature (e.g. the monster can fire [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow") from a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")); it will also not wake up [sleeping](/wiki/Sleeping "Sleeping") monsters, and does not target peacefuls unless the pyrolisk is strong enough to attack them. This can be exploited to kill [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") or the [Watch](/wiki/Watch "Watch") without the pyrolisk being attacked, although this will also [burn](/wiki/Burn "Burn") flammable items in their inventory - you will also need to keep pyrolisks far away from [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and [temples](/wiki/Temple "Temple") that you wish to make purchases from.

## History

The pyrolisk first appears in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), and makes its vanilla *NetHack* debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Origin

Pyrolisks are derived from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where they first appear in the game's 2nd edition. The pyrolisk's name is a contraction of *pyr* (Greek word πῦρ "fire") and *[basilisk](/wiki/Basilisk "Basilisk")*, a mythical snake-like monster closely related to the cockatrice. Pyrolisks are depicted as very similar in physical appearance to the cockatrice, with a rooster-like body, a reptilian tail and bat wings - among the few differentiating details are a red tint to the wings and a single red tail feather. Pyrolisks also live in similar temperate and tropical areas as cockatrices, and take over termite pits to make their nesting sites. Much like cockatrice corpses are still dangerous to the touch, pyrolisk bones radiate heat even after the pyrolisk is dead.

A pyrolisk is malevolent and actively spreads mayhem, attacking most other creatures they come across; they have a particular enmity towards the phoenix. Anyone meeting the gaze of a pyrolisk will burst into flame unless they are immune to fire or else can resist through force of will; this may be based on the deadly gaze that is often attributed to the cockatrice and basilisk in folklore. Pyrolisks can also cause nearby fires to burst into fireworks.

## Messages

- The pyrolisk attacks you with a fiery gaze!

  The pyrolisk is directing its gaze attack at you.

- The pyrolisk gazes at \<foo>...

  A pyrolisk directed its gaze at another monster.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the pyrolisk is given a different [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry that comes from the *[Shannara](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shannara "wikipedia:Shannara")* series of high fantasy novels written by [Terry Brooks](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Brooks "wikipedia:Terry Brooks"), where it is part of an in-universe bestiary written by the character Wizard Endlebrook.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), a pyrolisk only needs to be able to see its target for their gaze attack to damage them.

## Encyclopedia entry

At first glance around the corner, I thought it was another cockatrice. I had encountered the wretched creatures two or three times since leaving the open area. I quickly ducked my head back and considered what to do next. My heart had begun to thump audibly as I patted my pack to make sure I still had the dead lizards at close reach. A check of my attire showed no obvious holes or damage. I had to keep moving. One deep breath, and a count of three, two, one, and around the corner I bolted. But it was no cockatrice! I felt a sudden intense searing of the skin around my face, and flames began to leap from my pack. I tossed it to the ground, and quickly retreated back, around that corner, desperately striving to get out of its sight.

### SLASH'EM/SlashTHEM

A single glance from this red-feathered cockatrice can cause even the bravest adventurer to burst into flames, their flesh withering and blackening and curling beneath the creature's baleful gaze.

\[ The New Bestiary, Wizard Endlebrook ]
